title: Error E0301 "the parameter type `T` may not live long enough" could explain where the lifetime requirement comes from

labels.name: C-enhancement
labels.description: Category: An issue proposing an enhancement or a PR with one.

labels.name: A-diagnostics
labels.description: Area: Messages for errors, warnings, and lints

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
Error E0301 "the parameter type `T` may not live long enough" could explain where the lifetime requirement comes from.

Here's some example code where the `T: 'static` requirement comes implicitly from a `Box<Trait>` trait object (so 'static is invisible).

[playground](https://play.rust-lang.org/?gist=829eb1711d4a426b8dfebbaadcf5e512&version=stable&backtrace=0)

``` rust
trait Funny { }

fn new_funny_handle<T: Funny + Default>() -> Box<Funny> {
    Box::new(T::default())
}
```

``` rust
error: the parameter type `T` may not live long enough [--explain E0310]
 --> <anon>:5:5
5 |>     Box::new(T::default())
  |>     ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
help: consider adding an explicit lifetime bound `T: 'static`...
note: ...so that the type `T` will meet its required lifetime bounds
 --> <anon>:5:5
5 |>     Box::new(T::default())
  |>   
```
